tweets.text:
Not only has the @EnvAgency reduced itself to becoming nothing more than a hot bed of mediocrity and incompetence it appears it now also become an apologist and spin doctor for the water industry.

Over 3,100,000 hours worth of sewage dumped into our rivers in 2020. Shame on you. https://t.co/itIVQGDyk1

@Feargal_Sharkey @WaterUK @EnvAgency Some junior exec, prompted by a more senior exec, is scrambling right now to find the password and stop the pre-programmed propaganda tweets set for the Easter weekend!üòÇ

domain.description: Holidays like Christmas or Halloween

tweets.text: Why does the @EnvAgency promote these lies, last year on the @RiverChess we had 52 days when we had sewage discharges that had absolutely nothing to do with storm events. This year already we've had 70 days of sewage discharges that had absolutely nothing to do with storm events https://t.co/DiHw6dO6uY
Very good question Paul. Perhaps the leadership of the @EnvAgency and @DefraGovUK  might like to clarify why the Agency promotes this kind of lie. https://t.co/WUwAwmegKE

Come on @WaterUK, @EnvAgency, post your propaganda again about filling our rivers full of sh*t go on, I dare you.

https://t.co/oDqqDqJOwE https://t.co/TpY6cmHmi0

tweets.text:
What are storm overflows, and why do we use them?

Storm overflows play a role in preventing sewage from entering our homes or streets during periods of heavy rain or storms.

Watch our video to find out more about storm overflows: https://t.co/VBJFNTBAVE

tweets.text:
@numenini No need. The @EnvAgency have known about it for years.

That stretch of the Lark is listed as 'Moderate' status.

Reasons for not reaching 'Good'? Our old friends 'Over abstraction", i.e. low flows and 'Sewage discharge (continuous)".

Put the 2 together, you just filmed it. https://t.co/DPifRZP1Xi

Surprised how much algae & how few fish we saw in the #RiverLark from Farthing Bridge, Icklingham, upstream for 1 km. This Brook Lamprey was heading upstream. Current still quite strong.  
#Brooklampreys  #Chalkstreams #Freshwaterfishes #freshwaterfish   @Feargal_Sharkey 
5/6 https://t.co/ahC1TdiwpW

@Sarah_Winckless @theboatrace @matthewcpinsent @JenBartram @BBCSport @jamescracknell @CUBCsquad @stuartatcorpus @clarebalding @NatureUK @EnvAgency @metpoliceuk @MetPolice @OxfordUniBC @CambsCops @DanielZeichner Without prosecuting the environmental criminals we will continue to slide into very dangerous  'normalising' of extremist acts of ecological destruction imo @ClarenceHouse

tweets.text: @UnderwaterMedia Seeing the responses to the @EnvAgency tweet underlines the stupidity of their position on CSOs.

It's a genuine question.

Is this really what @pow_rebecca, @EmmaHowardBoyd & @JamesBevanEA hoped their careers would amount to?

Is this really what they were ambitious for, to become part time apologists for the industrial scale pollution of our rivers?

https://t.co/jfCFXkbEvG

They are cso's, if they was storm overflows they would only discharge in these periods of weather. We know they don't. We know sewage enters rivers regularly in periods of dry,normal weather or light rain. https://t.co/MMd2hJa72Q

tweets.text: @SianieRoo @EnvAgency Probably written by one of the air quality monitoring team themselves, rather than front-of-house. The technical team are decent, if under-resourced for a situation of this magnitude.
